dublin_core.dcvalue: The accurate and expeditious collection of survey data by coordinators in the field is critical in the support of research studies Early methods that used paper documentation have slowly evolved into electronic capture systems Indeed tools such as REDCap and others illustrate this transition However many current systems are tailored web browsers running on desktop laptop computers requiring keyboard and mouse input We present a system that utilizes a touch screen interface running on a tablet PC with consideration for portability limited screen space wireless connectivity and potentially inexperienced and low literacy users The system was developed using C ASP net and SQL Server by multiple programmers over the course of a year The system was developed in coordination with UCLA Family Medicine and is currently deployed for the collection of data in a group of Los Angeles area clinics of community health centers for a study on drug addiction and intervention
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T16:33:28Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2011-12-23
AMIA ... Annual Symposium proceedings / AMIA Symposium. AMIA Symposium
Wireless data collection of self-administered surveys using tablet computers.
